Articles.Content:
I was wondering, will 1.1 break my savegame? This would be good to know since it would make me play a bit sandbox and stop pushing my career mode.

I mean craft breaking is okay. The thing I'm worried about is alle the science I gathered (almost all in the SOI of kerbin).
It might be okay, but just incase it would be wise to not update. Finish your current play through then play 1.1. You can even make a seperate install and have both.

It's an engine update, one of the biggest internal changes a game can experience. If I were you, I would operate under the default assumption that it will horribly break existing saves.

If it ends up not breaking stuff, then I will have the pleasure of being positively surprised... and if it breaks, well, that's what I was prepared for anyway.
Pure stock games might be okay, but all bets are off on modded saves.

Man, I hope not, it would seriously screw up my fan-fiction story. 
But I'm making plans for how to rebuild my career game, just in case it does. 
1.1 will not destroy Emiko Station!!!
My OCD breaks my saves whenever there's a minor version, so I don't see much of a difference.
I'm always stunned that anyone would care.

Always plan for the worst; hope for the best.

With that said, yes, it will break your saved games. Your favorite mods will be outdated (for a while), and your modded craft won't load.

Bite the bullet, play vanilla mode for a while, and enjoy the new changes and new version of the game.

--- updated ---

Note: That response almost sounds like the forum game, "make a wish and have it horribly corrupted"...

Edited January 15, 2016 by adsii1970

3 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

Always plan for the worst; hope for the best.

With that said, yes, it will break your saved games. Your favorite mods will be outdated (for a while), and your modded craft won't load.

Bite the bullet, play vanilla mode for a while, and enjoy the new changes and new version of the game.

--- updated ---

Note: That response almost sounds like the forum game, "make a wish and have it horribly corrupted"...

wait..... to be specific, are you saying vanilla games might survive?

Just now, Just Jim said:

wait..... to be specific, are you saying vanilla games might survive?

In my previous experiences - yes. I run a vanilla game and a modded game. I've had the same vanilla game since .22, but in ALL fairness, as @Porkjet and others have changed stock parts, there are times that craft may not load or may look differently after updates are applied.

@SQUAD has been very good to its players in that there is little disruption to the game when played in vanilla mode. Now with the update to the new Unity platform, there could be some unintended consequences and even vanilla games may be broken. What I am planning to do is to update my saved games folder backup after each time I play (even on the vanilla game) so that if the saved game is broken, I can import the craft - at least...

1 minute ago, adsii1970 said:

In my previous experiences - yes. I run a vanilla game and a modded game. I've had the same vanilla game since .22, but in ALL fairness, as @Porkjet and others have changed stock parts, there are times that craft may not load or may look differently after updates are applied.

@SQUAD has been very good to its players in that there is little disruption to the game when played in vanilla mode. Now with the update to the new Unity platform, there could be some unintended consequences and even vanilla games may be broken. What I am planning to do is to update my saved games folder backup after each time I play (even on the vanilla game) so that if the saved game is broken, I can import the craft - at least...

Awesome!
I'm doing the same, saving the entire folder after I do something cool, just in case. 
And other than chatterer, which shouldn't hurt anything, I've been doing my project vanilla, so there may be a chance it will make it!
And even if it doesn't, if I can import the vehicles, I should be able to salvage the rest.

I always assume that there will be some changes to how things work, any part performance balancing is bound to affect something. I would guess that if you finish or land any critical or complex ships before you update then any impact will be minimal.

Keep your current version, and copy your save into the new one, then if it is broken you can still finish it anyway.

1 hour ago, adsii1970 said:

 

@SQUAD has been very good to its players in that there is little disruption to the game when played in vanilla mode. Now with the update to the new Unity platform, there could be some unintended consequences and even vanilla games may be broken. What I am planning to do is to update my saved games folder backup after each time I play (even on the vanilla game) so that if the saved game is broken, I can import the craft - at least...

It's a nice change of pacing for this forum to read a sentence begining with "SQUAD has been very good to its players", eh?

Oh man. I so wish I had the dilligence to keep the same save for long. I even deleted my backup saves a while back when I realized I was never going back for them.

1 hour ago, monstah said:

Oh man. I so wish I had the diligence to keep the same save for long. I even deleted my backup saves a while back when I realized I was never going back for them.

My problem is right now I have very little free time to play KSP - between the new semester starting, changes going on in the small business I run, and trying to create a new class for the summer, I am lucky if I get any time for gaming. If I do, it is because I am staying up way too late to do so. When I've been away from a game for a while, whether it is KSP, Cities: Skylines, Banished, Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri, or even Civilization V, and try to come back to a saved game, I forget what my overall strategy was... So, I then do what I always do... delete the saved game and start a new one.

20 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

My problem is right now I have very little free time to play KSP - between the new semester starting, changes going on in the small business I run, and trying to create a new class for the summer, I am lucky if I get any time for gaming. If I do, it is because I am staying up way too late to do so. When I've been away from a game for a while, whether it is KSP, Cities: Skylines, Banished, Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri, or even Civilization V, and try to come back to a saved game, I forget what my overall strategy was... So, I then do what I always do... delete the saved game and start a new one.

 

Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri... oh wow, I thought I was the only one that still played that!  Great game!

I believe the save game format is 100% under Squads direct control, so if it does break it won't be because of the game engine change.  Since there hasn't been a lot of mention of parts updating this round, even craft should be fairly safe (though versions after that we ARE expecting old rocket parts to get updated).

1 hour ago, Just Jim said:

Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri... oh wow, I thought I was the only one that still played that!  Great game!

Yes, it is a great game. It is why I was EXTREMELY disappointed in Sid Meier's Beyond Earth. I was hoping we would see some of the old within the new.

2 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

Yes, it is a great game. It is why I was EXTREMELY disappointed in Sid Meier's Beyond Earth. I was hoping we would see some of the old within the new. 

Agreed... I've tried some of the later ones, but I always go back to Alpha Centauri.
IF 1.1 breaks our games, saves or whatever, so what? We get to play them all again with a new update. Sounds great to me

Well, I've pushed quite far in my save.

I think once 1.1 comes, It's going to be time to start again.

And maybe I should start my Jool 5 mission then.

Well, the devs said somewhere ( IIRC in a SQUADCast some weeks ago ) that most likely 1.1 will not break savegames ... and given the structure of KSP saves, I tend to believe that it will be like that.

That is NOT the same as the saves giving similar behaviour in 1.05 and in 1.1. We already know that atleast antennas will not work in the same way and who knows what the optimization code cahnges will do to individual ships ( I do remember the issues Harv rework of the fuel lines code in 0,90 ( ? ) made to preexisting ships )

Oh and SMAC, great, GREAT game, probably the best Firaxis ever made. It is just too bad the game can't really handle better resolutions  ( the game can be upscaled, but ... )

2 hours ago, adsii1970 said:

(...) and try to come back to a saved game, I forget what my overall strategy was... So, I then do what I always do... delete the saved game and start a new one.

 

Oh man, Final Fantasy days all over

1.1 introduces new wheel and antenna mechanics, which means that every craft with these parts probably won't work anymore.

There might be other new stuff which even makes whole saves unloadable.
Who plays vanilla KSP? Yegh!

21 minutes ago, Jimbodiah said:

Who plays vanilla KSP? Yegh!  

I do...... why?
